hook.text: A bank robber covered his face with lemon juice, believing it made him invisible to cameras.

buildup.text: David Dunning and Justin Kruger found that the least skilled people overestimate their ability most.

discovery.text: Incompetence creates a double burden: poor performance and the inability to recognize it.

twist.text: Experts often underestimate themselves. More knowledge reveals how much you still don't know.

climax.text: The cure is feedback from others. External mirrors show what internal confidence distorts.

punchline.text: The less you know, the more certain you feel.

quiz.question: What does the Dunning-Kruger effect describe?
options: Least skilled people overestimate their ability most
Experts are always the most confident
